clinical_study.brief_title: Dysphagia and Cervical Spine Disorders in Patients With Brain Lesions
clinical_study.official_title: Dysphagia and Cervical Spine Disorders in Patients With Neurologic Deficits Due to Brain Lesions

brief_summary.textblock: The research is about a prospective study conducted in patients suffering from dysphagia and cervical spine disorders and how they are interrelated. Three questionnaires have been given to patients with neurologic deficits, the first of these investigates the occurence of dysphagia in the three stages of swallowing, the second looks into the quality of life following a stroke or other neurologic damage and the third analyses how cervical spine disorders can affect every day life. After the bedside examination, VFSS or FEES, the patients are submitted to swallowing and cervical resistance exercises in fixed time periods after their hospitalisation. The results will be collected and evaluated using the statistical programme SPSS.

primary_outcome.measure: change in swallowing ability and quality of life by swal-quol questionnaire
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of admittance to the rehabilitation department (baseline), at six weeks, at one year

primary_outcome.measure: change of swallowing ability by Okuma's questionnaire
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of admittance to the rehabilitation department (baseline), at six weeks, at one year

primary_outcome.measure: change of cervical scoliosis measured by Cobb method in x-rays
primary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of admittance to the rehabilitation department (baseline), at six weeks, at one year

secondary_outcome.measure: change of cervical oswestry disability index
secondary_outcome.time_frame: at the time of admittance to the rehabilitation department (baseline), at six weeks, at one year
secondary_outcome.description: this questionnaire will be distributed only to patients with previous cervical spine problems

arm_group.description: To investigate the swallowing ability of patients with neurologic problems
isometric exercises in patients with cervical spine scoliosis
To investigate the anatomic structures during swallowing of patients with neurologic problems

intervention.description: patients with cervical scoliosis will execute isometric exercises of the cervical spine
